config.question: Which of the following best describes critiques of Frederick Jackson Turner’s thesis of the settlement of the West?

choices.content: Turner’s thesis ignores the existence of free land and its continuous disappearance as factors in explaining American development.
Turner, being born in the post-settlement period and in the East, was not qualified to speculate on the reasons for American development.
The West was settled by diverse peoples in complex patterns, not simply by white Americans moving west.
Turner discounted the effect of individualism and its offshoots in trying to explain the reasons for American development.

answer_2.response: Consider This: Historians have modified Turner’s thesis by pointing to frontier conservatism and imitativeness, the influence of racial groups, and the persistence of European ideas and institutions. Rejecting Turner almost completely, a group of “new Western historians” has advanced a different and complex view of the West. See L.O. 17.4 Why was the West a bonanza of dreams and get-rich-quick schemes?
